About: Citropsis gilletiana, commonly known as the Gillet's citropsis, is a tropical fruit tree native to the rainforests of Central and West Africa. It is characterized by its small, edible fruits that are typically yellow or orange when ripe. The tree is valued for its potential in agroforestry and its contributions to local diets, and it is often found in areas with high humidity and well-drained soils.

Details.Fertilizing: Every 2 to 4 months apply liquid fertilizer

About: The potato, scientifically known as Solanum tuberosum, is a perennially growing crop with an annual life cycle. It has a starchy, tuberous root that stores nutrients, and its stem and leaves are characterized by large, lobed leaves with white, purple or pink flowers. Potatoes are an important source of carbohydrates and are also a great source of dietary fiber, vitamin C, and potassium.

Details.Fertilizing: Apply balanced fertilizer every 4 to 6 weeks

About: Coffea is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rubiaceae. It includes over 120 species of shrubs and small trees that produce coffee beans, which are used to make the popular beverage coffee. Coffea plants are native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas.

Details.Fertilizing: Every 2 to 4 months apply liquid fertilizer

About: Malus pumila 'Dewar' STARKSPUR ULTRA MAC, commonly known as Dwarf Apple, is an ornamental fruiting tree with an upright, rounded form. It produces abundant white flowers in spring and attractive red fruits in the summer. This dwarf variety is self-sterile and needs another apple variety to pollinate it.

Details.Fertilizing: Apply balanced fertilizer in early spring and late fall

About: Saccharum is a genus of tall perennial grasses in the family Poaceae, native to warm temperate to tropical regions of the Old World. They are commonly known as sugarcane and are cultivated for their high sugar content.

Details.Fertilizing: Every 2 to 4 months apply liquid fertilizer

About: Cayenne pepper (Capsicum annuum) is an amazing spice that packs a punch of flavor and adds a delightful heat to any dish. Not only does it work wonderfully in a variety of dishes, but it also has great health benefits. Studies have shown that the capsaicin found in cayenne pepper has been linked to reducing inflammation and having antioxidants, thus lowering the risk of some diseases. Furthermore, inclusion of cayenne pepper to one's diet can even help with weight loss. Cayenne pepper is an incredibly versatile and tasty ingredient, making it a must-have in every kitchen pantry

Details.Fertilizing: Apply balanced fertilizer every 3 weeks during the growing season

About: Triticum aestivum, commonly known as common wheat or bread wheat, is a cereal grain that is cultivated worldwide. It is a staple food for a large part of the world's population and is used to make bread, pasta, noodles, and other food products.

Details.Fertilizing: Apply nitrogen-rich fertilizer during tillering stage

About: Summer squash (Cucurbita pepo) is amazing because it's both delicious and nutritious! Low in calories but high in fiber and many vitamins and minerals, this squash is a great way to get in your daily servings of vegetables. This warm season crop is also easy to grow, requiring very little maintenance once established. Its vibrant yellow and green colors can brighten up any plate. It can also be eaten fresh, grilled, baked, or boiled. Plus, its leaves, flowers, immature fruits, and seeds are all edible. Summer squash is definitely a must-have for your garden!

Details.Fertilizing: Apply balanced fertilizer during growing season

About: Garlic (Allium sativum 'Inchelium Red') is a unique and flavorful variety of garlic. It features large, purple-red bulbs that contain more of the spicy, flavorful compounds that make garlic so amazing. It is rich in antioxidants, vitamins, and minerals that can help maintain health, and has antiviral, antifungal, and antibacterial properties. Plus, the Inchelium Red variety has a very long storage life, so you can store it in a cool and dry place for up to eight months. In addition, it has a wonderful flavor that adds a zing to dishes, making it a great choice for any chef. In short, garlic (Allium sativum 'Inchelium Red') is truly amazing!

Details.Fertilizing: Apply organic fertilizer during early spring and late fall

About: Onion (Allium cepa) is an amazing and versatile vegetable that has been used in cooking for centuries. Its taste is powerful yet complex, and it adds flavor and texture to many dishes. Onions are incredibly nutritious and are packed with essential vitamins and minerals including vitamin C, folate, iron, and potassium. Not only that, but onions may also have antiseptic, antibiotic, and antioxidant properties. They are an excellent source of dietary fiber and possess anti-inflammatory compounds. Onions are easy to grow in any garden, and they come in a variety of sizes, shapes and colors, making them a unique and beautiful ornamental plant. Its versatility in cooking, nutritional content, and medicinal properties combined with its decorative appearance make the onion a truly remarkable species.

Details.Fertilizing: Apply balanced fertilizer every 3 to 4 weeks during active growth period
